name: Embarcadero Inn

reviews.text: The title says it all. First, the troubles...I booked a night by internet and arrived the next day for our room. We had mistakenly booked the night before. I hoped that we could then pay the extra for the night that we did show up, but the manager was completely rude and basically said tough on you. Rather than work with the customer, she preferred to alienate us. The hotel was nearly empty, off season next to the beach, but no chance we could work this out. The room was okay, but there was a dredger just outside the hotel making noise until late in the night. The rudeness and absolutely un-businesslike way the management ran the place would keep me from ever coming back here again.
reviews.title: Management Unfriendly, I Would Never Stay Here Again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our stay at the Embarcadero in was totally enjoyable and good value. The rooms are spacious, comfortable and well maintained. On foggy nights (not uncommon in Morro bay) the fire place is a real plus. The hotel is clean and a good design. The staff were freindly and helpful. My wife and I do a lot of traveling a would rate this hotel excellent (especially for the off season rates.)
reviews.title: Probably the best value available in Morro Bay,

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Okay, first I have to say that this place has the most fabulously powerful showers we have ever encountered. I've paid a hundred bucks for a massage that good. The front desk told me it's a common compliment... they just have awesome water pressure.
reviews.title: Fantastic shower, tremendous value, great location

reviews.text: On to the more conventional aspects of the review... we found lots of vacancies here over the Thanksgiving weekend, and got a big, beautiful third-floor room with a king bed, all the amenities and a lovely harbor view for less than we paid in Cambria. The desk folks are pleasant and helpful, and the location is perfect, right at the south end of the utterly charming waterfront street, with a string of great restaurants and nice shops. We also highly recommend a walk south from the hotel along the boat harbor, either late night or early morning. Beautiful.
reviews.title: Amazing hotel for families

reviews.text: So why does this place only get four stars? I have to reluctantly deduct one for the sub-par mattress. I was somewhat uncomfortable during the night and woke up with an achy back. Other than that (and the skimpy breakfast choices), this place gets a thumb's up from us.
reviews.title: Amazing views of sea otters at play

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First let me start off by saying most of the hotels in Morro Bay are OLD. It's part of the charm. This one was not as old as many. It was well cared for and we enjoyed our stay. The Embarcadero Inn is right on the Embarcadero .. across the street is water! Its at the south end, about 5 minute walk away from all the shops/touristy areas. This is really a great location - close enough to walk on over, but not have to deal with the parking, or noise of it all. I think all the rooms have water views, which is nice. We had a little house across the street, but we were on the 2nd floor so we could see over it.
reviews.title: Nice Morro Bay Hotel

reviews.text: Check in was quick and easy. We got a decent price for the room, and I felt like it was a good value. The room was pretty nice, dated, but nice and comfortable. We had a King size bed, table and a chair, small frig, microwave, dresser & old style tv. Small balcony with a couple chairs, and the best part was that the hotel jacuzzi was right across the hall. The bathroom was a typical small hotel bathroom. Nothing special, but it was clean and had great water pressure. I did like the fact that the shower/toilet were in a separate little room so you could close that door for privacy, while someone else used the sink area. The shower curtain was very thick rubber/plastic of some sort - it was driving me nuts because it kept hitting you as you are in the shower, but thats just a nit picky thing. Bed was comfy and we slept well. They offered a continental breakfast, just pastries mostly, coffee and juice.
reviews.title: I would stay there again!

reviews.text: The hotel offers free dvd rentals, which is nice. They also include a free pkg of popcorn in the microwave which was cute. Free wireless, free covered parking, with window washing stations all over the lot, which I thought was very nice.. Employees all seemed very pleasant. We enjoyed our stay, and would stay here again.
reviews.title: Reasonable stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was fine with everything except for the beds. They were not at all comfy. We stayed in room 208 and paid $155 a night.
reviews.title: Great Place to Stay !
Welcoming relaxing stopover as we drove up from SoCal
reviews.text: We stayed there for just one night. Clean room, prompt service. Shampoo and soap came through dispensers which while not greatly appealing, was tolerable. Good bed and pillows. Continental breakfast with standard items was on the 3rd floor and helped us from having to look for breakfast elsewhere in the morning. Didn't use the available Hot spa but when we took a look it was neat and deserted. My only problem is with the partial view of the QQ room that we booked. We went on a week day and paid $155.00 for the night. The excuse of a view we had was the tip end of a sail boat and the water around it that was barely seen through the slits of the buildings right in front and the full view rooms jutting on both sides of the balcony from the same building. Even that was impeded by a large crane from an ongoing construction. We stayed in room #212. So at least for the 2nd floor rooms b/n the full view rooms with the bldngs in front should not be described as having any view. The nearness to Embarcadero street and the Bay itself was pretty good and we enjoyed our stay. Pelican Grill next door served a decent dinner and Giovanni's Fish Market all the way at the end of the street stood up to its reputation for fresh fish and chips. I like it when the batter is thin. Estero, Anderson Inn, Gray's Inn etc are on the water side of Embarcadero street and Embarcadero Inn was on the opposite side. To be fair the Inn has no control over how the buildings come up on the other side I guess. So if you are expecting to enjoy any partial view I will not recommend it but otherwise the stay was good. We drove to the beach which is at walkable distance and external showering up facilities was after was better than Monterey. The place itself and the streets reminded me a little of Carmel/Monterey. Natural History Museum was wonderful. We plan to make another visit when the Monarch Butterflies arrive. It is also a great place for bird watching. Morro Rock is spectacular and can be seen in many states throughout the day due to the coastal fog. A photographer's dream if the Sun will eventually come out to change the all masking fog.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having booked ourselves into a disappointing motel, we went in search of a better place to spend our vacation. Fortunately, we happened upon the Embarcadero Inn in Morro Bay. Located across the street from the bay, this hotel is a fine place to stay. Very clean rooms. Offering all the usual amenities, such as in-room coffee maker, hair dryer, comfy beds, refrigerator, plus goodies such as a gas fireplace, ocean view balcony with chairs and table, and a nice continental breakfast every morning. We availed ourselves of one of the 2 jacuzzi tubs, which was very clean and not overly-chlorined. Free on-site parking. Security building with keyed elevator and stairways. Convenient to all the shopping and restaurants. We highly recommend the Embarcadero Inn and look forward to returning there ourselves.
reviews.title: A Wonderful Surprise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After reading many reviews I booked at this motel. This is a no frills motel that in my opinion, is not worth the money. It had average to below average but fairly clean rooms, the spa was not working, the internet access was only in the breakfast room, and even then, we couldn't access it. The location is the only thing this motel has going for it.
reviews.title: Definitely not worth the money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for one night whilst driving route 1. The rooms are large and very comfortable, with nice views of the bay, and much better decorated than chain hotels/motels. The rooms are very quiet and the beds very comfy, so you can be sure of a good night's sleep. The complimentary breakfast was much better than most. The girl who checked us in really couldn't be bothered, but we only had to deal with her once. This place is a little pricier than the chain motels on the outskirts of town, but I think it's worth the extra.
reviews.title: Very nice stop-over hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Morro Bay isn't a particularly special or pretty place, but was a very convenient halfway point on our drive from Monteray Bay to Santa Barbara.
reviews.title: Big rooms / Big breakfast!

reviews.text: Wow, the room was huge. I only stayed there one night to attend a wedding but it was really clean, and I liked how they were trying to be eco friendly with their bathroom amenities. Also has a Dvd player, that I later learned you can borrow movies from the front desk to watch as well as a fridge, microwave etc.
reviews.title: Good value

reviews.text: The hotel is OK (over-priced and fairly basic/standard) but Morro is not so do not go to the hotel.
reviews.title: Do Not Go To Miserable Morro

reviews.text: Morro is one of the most miserable places we stayed - not just because of the mists and cold (in June) but also the lack of prom and places to wander.
reviews.title: Enter the Time Machine

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Help-yourself breakfast was pretty good.
reviews.title: Wow this is the place to stay!!

reviews.text: Good range of free DVDs for family.
reviews.title: Family suite was sweet except for the sound of feet

reviews.text: We expecyed more for the money we paid.
reviews.title: Brilliantly impressed

description: Family owned and operated since 1986, this completely smoke-free, 32-room hotel has all the amenities, including flat-panel TVs, microwaves, refrigerators and coffee makers. Each room faces the bay, most with private balconies and many with fireplaces. Free deluxe FreshFirst continental breakfast and free WiFi through out the hotel. Several room types are available, including standard rooms with queen or king beds, suites and a 2BR Family Suite. A state-of-the-art stainless steel hot tub that can accommodate up to 8 people is a must-use during your stay. Secure access to rooms elevator and free, covered parking is available to our guests.
